title: Drawing, "Flowering Plant and a Rock between the American and Canadian Falls at Niagara", possibly 1858
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite at left:  yellow flower / Laky red stem / Niagara
Verso: Inscribed in graphite at various locations: Light / shadow
description:
Recto: Horizontal view showing a plant and its blossom, at left; and a rock between the American And Canadian falls, at center.
Verso: Horizontal view of the Canadian Falls at Niagara with an indication of the tower at left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Flowering Plant and a Rock between the American and Canadian Falls at Niagara", possibly 1858.
possibly 1858. Graphite on green paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-124.
